STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 7, 2025
Kevin Mitchell
Washtenaw County Youth Center
4125 Washtenaw Ave.
Ann Arbor, MI, 48108-1003
Re: License #: CE810254752
Dear Kevin Mitchell:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
4/28/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Brittany Cowans, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4154 Shelter care and detention institutions; service
plans.
(1) Within 30 calendar days after admission and
every 15 calendar days thereafter, an institution
shall complete a written service plan. The service
plan shall include all of the following:
2

(a) The reason for continued care.
One out of three youth files inspected did not have a service plan completed every
15 calendar days as required per rule.
CCI Rule 400.4154 Shelter care and detention institutions; service
plans.
(1) Within 30 calendar days after admission and
every 15 calendar days thereafter, an institution
shall complete a written service plan. The service
plan shall include all of the following:
(b) Evaluation of service needs.
One out of three youth files inspected did not have a service plan completed every
15 calendar days as required per rule.

plans.
(1) Within 30 calendar days after admission and
every 15 calendar days thereafter, an institution shall
complete a written service plan. The service plan
shall include all of the following:
(c) Ongoing service needs.
One out of three youth files inspected did not have a service plan completed every
15 calendar days as required per rule.

(d) How service needs will be met.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Discharge document to automatically have "none or "N/A" for the line of services
provided by the agency after discharge as the agency does not provide after care
services.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not required or requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency was required to submit one corrective action plan during this period
under review. The agency was cited regarding submission timing of new employee
documents and out of state checks. The agency implemented their CAP and
completed CAP reviews with staff to improve compliance. During the 2025 interim
inspection it was determined the agency demonstrated successful implementation
of their CAP, as there were no repeat violations found.
Financial Overview
The agency's 2025 budget was reviewed on-site. No concerns were found.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
4

The facility appears to be in compliance with PREA.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site. The
Chief Administrator (CA) reported there are no barriers to compliance of rules. The
CA ensures implementation of monthly check-in's with staff, Management Analyst
and Administrative Coordinator review of youth files at intake and discharge (paper
version scanned into case management system), and personnel files reviewed
before clearing new staff for orientation/training.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were completed with three staff members. Staff did not report any
concerns. Staff reported that they love working at the facility and the program is
servicing the children well. All reporting feeling supported by their current
supervisor.
Interviews were completed with three youth. The youth did not report any concerns.
Each youth reported that they enjoy the food and every Saturday morning, they
have homemade breakfast. Each youth identified several staff members they felt
comfortable going to if they have any issues. All understood the grievance protocol.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the entire facility was completed. The facility was well
maintained, clean, and well organized. All bedrooms in use had appropriate
bedding. The bathrooms were viewed to have running water, working toilets,
working sinks and working showers. The kitchen was also in clean condition. There
was an appropriate amount of food and the menus were posted. All client files and
medications were locked up. Viewed the school classrooms. There were no safety
concerns noted
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
